blocks.name: cur
blocks.content: Extend class notation with ring unit.

blocks.name: df-ur
blocks.content: Define the multiplicative neutral element of a ring. This definition works by extracting the ` 0g ` element, i.e. the neutral element in a group or monoid, and transferring it to the multiplicative monoid via the ` mulGrp ` function ( ~ df-mgp ). See also ~ dfur2 , which derives the "traditional" definition as the unique element of a ring which is left- and right-neutral under multiplication. (Contributed by NM, 27-Aug-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-Dec-2014.)

blocks.name: ringidval
blocks.content: The value of the unity element of a ring. (Contributed by NM, 27-Aug-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-Dec-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm ringidval(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wceq(c0, cfv(c0g, c1))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cmgp, c2))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cur, c2))
} = {
  3eqtr4i(c0, cfv(c0g, c1), cfv(cur, c2), cfv(c0g, cfv(cmgp, c2)))
  pm2.61i(wceq(cfv(cur, c2), cfv(c0g, cfv(cmgp, c2))), wcel(c2, universe))
  syl5eq(cfv(cur, c2), cfv(c0g, cfv(cmgp, c2)), cfv(ccom(c0g, cmgp), c2), wcel(c2, universe))
  fveq1i(cur, c2, ccom(c0g, cmgp))
  df-ur()
  mpan(wcel(c2, universe), wceq(cfv(ccom(c0g, cmgp), c2), cfv(c0g, cfv(cmgp, c2))), wfn(cmgp, universe))
  fnmgp()
  fvco2(cmgp, universe, c2, c0g)
  3eqtr4a(cfv(cur, c2), cfv(c0g, cfv(cmgp, c2)), emptycls, cfv(c0g, emptycls), wn(wcel(c2, universe)))
  0g0()
  fvprc(c2, cur)
  fveq2d(c0g, cfv(cmgp, c2), emptycls, wn(wcel(c2, universe)))
  fvprc(c2, cmgp)
  fveq2i(c0g, c1, cfv(cmgp, c2))
}

blocks.name: dfur2
blocks.content: The multiplicative identity is the unique element of the ring that is left- and right-neutral on all elements under multiplication. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Jan-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm dfur2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wceq(c0, cio(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wral(s1, c1, wa(wceq(co(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1)), cv(s1)), wceq(co(cv(s1), c2, cv(s0)), cv(s1)))))))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c3))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cmulr, c3))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cur, c3))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
} = {
  grpidval(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, cfv(cmgp, c3))
  mgpbas(c1, cfv(cmgp, c3), c3)
  mgpplusg(c2, cfv(cmgp, c3), c3)
  ringidval(c0, cfv(cmgp, c3), c3)
  eqid(cfv(cmgp, c3))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cmgp, c3)
  diff.cmgp.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, cmgp, c3)
  diff.cmgp.s(s1)
}
